pullRequest.title: [coolmasternet] General tidy up of addon
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please refer to the Git commit message for details.
The only functional improvement in this commit is the polling is much faster, as it now differentiates between an existing connection and a new connection.

beforeCommit.message:
[coolmasternet] General tidy up of addon

Changes include:

* Remove shadow local variables
* Fix JavaDocs (use proper syntax and tags)
* Consistent comments (inline, not block or JavaDoc)
* Eliminate magic number
* Shorten lines to improve readability
* Return from failed methods earlier to improve readability
* Use final where possible
* Rename refresh to poller
* Stop using custom exception except for specific protocol case
* Rationalise exception handling (centralise catch and log)
* Synchronize on appropriate final object for polling use case
* Centralise thing state reporting logic
* Accelerate commands by using shorter sink timeout where connected
* Add polling duration trace message
* Apply Spotless plugin

This has been tested on a CoolMasterNet system. This includes various
breaking conditions such as introducing the wrong address to the
bridge etc and ensuring bridge and HVAC states vary as
expected (including returning to online states when breaking
conditions were corrected).

Signed-off-by: Ben Alex <ben.alex@acegi.com.au>

nodes.bodyText: This message wouldn't be very helpful for debugging
It would be more optimal to save the ControllerConfiguration to a field during initialization so you don't need to create it each time. Creating the configuration class is a costly procedure.
Please move static fields to the top of the class.

nodes.bodyText: The controller might already be offline due to not having a bridge.
Same suggestion as my previous review.
It would be better to handle per-channel refreshes since the UI could spam refreshes for multiple channels at once causing you to make a lot of unnecessary queries and channel updates.
Should probably also check if the ControllerHandler is null here and change thing status accordingly.

nodes.bodyText: Why not use the constructor that handles formatting for you?

If you are looking to make good general improvements to make, then you could wrap this output stream in a OutputStreamWriter so you can let the writer deal with Charset conversions for you. Should allow you to get rid of the LF constant you are using below.
